fig.title: a) Induction of GFP+ dots in differentiated THP-1 cells stably expressing GFP-LC3, left untransfected or transfected for 6 h with poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf1
fig.sd-panel: (a) Induction of GFP+ dots in differentiated THP-1 cells stably expressing GFP-LC3, left untransfected or transfected for 6 h with poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml), then exposed to control antibody (Control Ab), antibody to neutralize IL-1β (Anti-IL-1β), dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) or 3-MA (5 mM); results are presented as quantification of GFP-LC3+ dots (top) and images of individual cells (middle). Scale bars, 10 μm.

(b) Expression of AIM2 and beclin-1 in cells transfected with control siRNA or siRNA targeting AIM2 or beclin-1; numbers below lanes indicate band intensity (ratio of cells transfected with targeting siRNA to those transfected with control siRNA).

(c) Induction of GFP+ dots in differentiated THP-1 cells stably expressing GFP-LC3 and treated with various siRNAs (below graph), quantified 6 h after transfection with poly(dA:dT) (+) or no transfection (-).

(d) Immunoblot analysis of the expression of LC3-I and LC3-II (above) in wild-type (WT) and Aim2−/− BMDMs left untransfected or transfected for 6 h with poly(dA:dT); numbers below lanes indicate division of the ratio of induced LC3-I to induced LC3-II by the ratio of basal LC3-I to basal LC3-II (band intensities). Below, immunoblot analysis of IL-1β in supernatants after overnight culture.

(e) Immunoblot analysis of LC3-I and LC3-II in or wild-type, ASC-deficient (Pycard-/-; called 'Asc-/-' here) or caspase-1-deficient (Casp1-/-) BMDMs primed with LPS (20 ng/ml) and then left untransfected or transfected with poly(dA:dT) or left untreated or treated with nigericin for 4 h; numbers below lanes as in d. Actin serves as a loading control throughout. NS, not significant; *P 0.05 and **P 0.01 (unpaired t-test). Data are from three individual experiments

fig.title: a) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells transfected for 3 h with Cy3-labeled poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf2

sd-panel.p: (a) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells transfected for 3 h with Cy3-labeled poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml). Yellow dots (Merge) indicate colocalization of green (LC-3) and red (Cy3) signals. Scale bars, 10 μm.

(b) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells transfected to express Cy3-poly(dA:dT), imaged every 15 min starting 1 h after transfection (numbers in bottom left corners indicate time in min (m)). Arrow indicates coalescence of the Cy3 and GFP signals (also in bottom right image).

(c) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells sham-transfected with no poly(dA:dT) (Control) or transfected with poly(dA:dT), then fixed and immunostained for ASC (red). Insets (bottom right), 5× enlargement of areas indicated by arrowheads at left. Scale bars, 10 μm (top) or 20 μm (bottom).
(d) Confocal microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells transfected with poly(dA:dT) and immunostained for LAMP-1 and ASC; below, z-axis projections. Scale bars, 10 μm.

(e) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells treated for 2 h with LPS (500 ng/ml) and ATP (3 mM), then immunostained for ASC (red): left image in each pair, three-dimensional volume renderings reconstructed from z-stack images; right image in each pair, surface-segmentation models (2× enlargement). Scale bars, 10 μm.

(f) Electron microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells stimulated with LPS and ATP (left) or transfected with poly(dA:dT) (right) for 2 h and immunostained for ASC, visualized with 15-nm gold-conjugated protein A. Red arrows indicate ASC immunostaining. Right image in each pair, 4.5× enlargement of outlined area at left. Scale bars, 500 nm. Data are representative of three experiments (a,c) or two experiments (b,d-f).

fig.title: a) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells left untransfected (Control) or transfected for 2 h with poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf3

sd-panel.p: (a) Confocal microscopy of differentiated GFP-LC3+ THP-1 cells left untransfected (Control) or transfected for 2 h with poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml), then immunostained for endogenous AIM2
(b) Confocal microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells transfected for 3 h with poly(dA:dT), then immunostained for LAMP-1 and AIM2.

(c) Confocal microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells left untreated or treated for 2 h with LPS (500 ng/ml) and ATP (3 mM), then immunostained for endogenous LC3 and NLRP3. Scale bars, 10 μm. Data are representative of at least three experiments.

fig.title: a) Immunoblot analysis of AIM2, ASC and LC3-II in lysates of differentiated THP-1 cells left untransfected or transfected with poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf4

sd-panel.p: (a) Immunoblot analysis of AIM2, ASC and LC3-II in lysates of differentiated THP-1 cells left untransfected or transfected with poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml) and left untreated or treated with 3-MA, rapamycin or amino-acid starvation, then separated into an inflammasome-enriched fraction (top) or an autophagosome-enriched fraction (middle). Bottom, immunoblot analysis of total cell lysates.
(b) Immunoblot analysis of unprocessed and processed caspase-1 and IL-1β in lysates and supernatants of differentiated THP-1 cells treated as in a.

(c) Immunoblot analysis of LC3-I and LC3-II (top) in lysates of mouse BMDMs primed with LPS (20 ng/ml) and left untreated or treated with alum, then left unexposed or exposed for 5 h to live (Live TB) or dead (Dead TB) M. tuberculosis (numbers below lanes as in Fig. 1d). Below, immunoblot analysis of IL-1β in supernatants of LPS-primed mouse BMDMs infected overnight with live M. tuberculosis in the presence or absence of 3-MA (2 mM); treatment with LPS and ATP serves as a positive control. Data are representative of at least two experiments.

fig.title: a) Immunoblot analysis of ASC immunoprecipitates (IP; left) and total lysates (right) of differentiated THP-1 cells left untransfected or transfected for 2 h with poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf5

sd-panel.p: (a) Immunoblot analysis of ASC immunoprecipitates (IP; left) and total lysates (right) of differentiated THP-1 cells left untransfected or transfected for 2 h with poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml), probed for beclin-1 and ASC (below), then stripped and reprobed for p62 (above).
(b) Confocal microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells treated as in a, immunostained for p62 (green) and ASC (red); arrows indicate colocalized proteins.

(c) Confocal microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells treated for 2 h with LPS (500 ng/ml) and ATP (3mM), immunostained for p62 (green) and ASC (red): left two images, merged channel volume and surface rendering of a three-dimensional reconstruction; right four images, enlargement of images at left (yellow arrow), with arrows indicating removal of part of the signal to reveal the red signal (ASC) inside the green-stained area (p62).

(d) Immunoblot analysis of lysates of cells transfected twice with siRNA with scrambled sequence (−) or siRNA specific for beclin-1 or p62; numbers below lanes indicate band intensity (as in Fig. 1b).

(e) Immunoblot analysis of the inflammasome and autophagosome fractions and total lysates of differentiated THP-1 cells transfected as in d, with poly(dA:dT) included in the second transfection; lysates were prepared 4 h after the final transfection.

(f) Immunoblot analysis of supernatants and lysates of differentiated THP-1 cells treated as in e; supernatants were collected after culture for 6 h in serum-free medium. Scale bars (b,c), 10 μm. Data are representative of at least two experiments.

fig.title: a) Immunoblot analysis of ASC immunoprecipitates of differentiated THP-1 cells transfected for 2h with poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf6

sd-panel.p: (a) Immunoblot analysis of ASC immunoprecipitates of differentiated THP-1 cells transfected for 2h with poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml), probed for ubiquitin (Ub), then stripped and reprobed for K63-linked ubiquitin (Ub-K63), then stripped and reprobed for ASC.
(b) Immunoassay of differentiated THP-1 cells treated as in a with protein-dissociation buffer, followed by immunoprecipitation of ASC (24 kilodaltons (kDa)) and immunoblot analysis.

(c) Confocal microscopy of differentiated THP-1 cells transfected for 2 h with poly(dA:dT), immunostained for ASC (red) and polyubiquitin (green). PolyUb, polyubiquitination. Scale bars, 10 μm. Brackets (right margins in a,b) indicate smear of ubiquitinated proteins. Data are representative of three (a,c) or two (b) experiments.

fig.title: a) Immunoblot analysis of lysates of human monocytes-macrophages primed with LPS (10 ng) and then transfected with poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf7

sd-panel.p: (a) Immunoblot analysis of lysates of human monocytes-macrophages primed with LPS (10 ng) and then transfected with poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml) or treated with nigericin (4 μM) for 6 h (numbers below lanes as in Fig. 1d).

(b) Immunoblot analysis of processed caspase-1 and IL-1β (top) and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay of IL-1β (middle) in supernatants of monocytes-macrophages treated for 6 h with various combinations (bottom) of poly(dA:dT) (b) or nigericin (c), plus 3-MA and amino-acid starvation. *P 0.01 (unpaired t test).

(d) Confocal microscopy of LPS-primed human monocytes-macrophages transfected for 3 h with poly(dA:dT) (top), treated for 3 h with nigericin (middle) or left unstimulated (bottom), immunostained for p62 (green) and ASC (red); arrows indicate colocalized proteins. Second row, three-dimensional volume rendering reconstructed from confocal z-stack images. Scale bars, 10 μm. Data are representative of at least two experiments.

fig.title: a) Immunoblot analysis of lysates of LPS (20 ng/ml)–primed mouse BMDMs exposed to LPS (500 ng/ml) and ATP (3 μM), poly(dA:dT) (1.
fig.label: figf8

sd-panel.p: (a) Immunoblot analysis of lysates of LPS (20 ng/ml)-primed mouse BMDMs exposed to LPS (500 ng/ml) and ATP (3 μM), poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml) or uric acid crystals (50 μg/ml), detecting GTP-bound RalB (collected by RaBP1-agarose affinity purification) and RalB in total lysates.

(b) Immunoblot analysis of lysates and supernatants of mouse BMDMs transfected with control or RalB-specific siRNA on 2 sequential days, then primed with LPS and exposed for 6 h to poly(dA:dT) (1.5 μg/ml), probed for RalB, LC3 and IL-1β; supernatants were collected after overnight culture in serum-free medium (numbers below lanes as in Fig. 1d). Nonsp, nonspecific band.

(c) Immunoblot analysis of lysates of wild-type and Aim2−/− mouse BMDMs transfected with control or AIM2-specific siRNA on 2 sequential days, primed for 2 h with LPS and then exposed for 1 h to poly(dA:dT) (numbers below lanes as in Fig. 1d).

(d) Immunoblot analysis of ASC immunoprecipitates from LPS-primed mouse BMDMs left untreated or transfected for 1 h with poly(dA:dT) and treated for 30 min with LPS and ATP. Mock, immunoprecipitation with control antibody.

(e) Confocal microscopy of LPS-primed mouse BMDMs left untransfected or transfected for 30 min with poly(dA:dT), immunostained for RalB and AIM2 (left three columns); RalB and ASC (middle columns); and beclin-1 and AIM2 (right two columns). Bottom row, 3× electronic enlargement of areas outlined above. Scale bars, 10 μm. Data are representative of at least two experiments.
